revision.comment: +Template
revision.text:
'''Light dues''' are the charges levied on ships for the maintenance of [[lighthouse]]s and other [[navigation aid|aids to navigation]].
==British Isles== Light dues are levied on commercial vessels and larger pleasure boats calling at ports in the [[British Isles]] and paid into the '''General Lighthouse Fund''' (GLF), which is under the stewardship of the UK's [[Department for Transport]] and is used to finance the lighthouse services provided by the three [[General Lighthouse Authority|General Lighthouse Authorities]] that cover all of the British Isles: * [[Trinity House]] for England, Wales, Gibraltar and the Channel Islands * [[Northern Lighthouse Board]] for Scotland and the Isle of Man * [[Commissioners of Irish Lights]] for the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland
The main principles of the light dues system are:<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.trinityhouse.co.uk/th/about/funding.html |title=Funding |publisher=Trinity House |date= |accessdate=2011-11-16}}</ref> * The UK [[Department for Transport]] sets the level of light dues in the UK, which is reviewed annually, taking advice from the General Lighthouse Authorities and representatives of the shipping industry. The Irish [[Department of Transport, Tourism and Sport]] sets the level of light dues in the Republic of Ireland. * In most cases, the rate charged is based on the net registered tonnage of the vessel. The current UK rate (from 1 May 2017) is 37.5 pence per net registered ton, with a maximum charge of £15,000 per voyage (equivalent to 40,000 tons); in Ireland it is 60 cent, with a maximum charge of 24,000Euro. * A vessel pays light dues when it first calls at a port in the UK or Ireland; thereafter it is exempt from further payments for one month. Each vessel is charged for a maximum of nine voyages per annum. * Vessels calling in the UK and Republic of Ireland are required to pay the rate applicable at the port where they are first liable to pay light dues. The nine voyage cap applies regardless of whether the port calls are in the UK or Ireland. * Tugs and fishing vessels (of 10metres in length or more) make an annual payment based on the registered length of the vessel. Pleasure boats (of 20tons or more) make a monthly payment up to an annual maximum.
Increasing automation of aids to navigation in the British Isles has seen the rate of Light Dues fall in real terms over recent years. The first increase in the Light Dues rate for twenty years occurred in 2009. In 2010, with the rate at 41p, the UK Government announced that there would be no further increases for at least the next three years.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dft.gov.uk/news/statements/penning-20101208 |title=Government support for the maritime industry and light dues update |publisher=Department for Transport |date=2010-12-08 |accessdate=2011-11-16}}</ref> The rate was then cut by one penny in each of 2014, 2015 and 2016, with a further half penny in 2017 to reach its current level of 37.5p.<ref>https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/light-dues-2017-to-2018</ref>
Also in 2010, the UK Government announced it had reached agreement with the Irish Government that aids to navigation off the coast of the Republic of Ireland would be wholly funded from domestic sources there by 2015-16.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dft.gov.uk/news/press-releases/dft-press-20110118 |title=UK and Irish Ministers agree reform for funding of Irish Lights |publisher=Department for Transport |date=2011-01-18 |accessdate=2011-11-16}}</ref> Changes to the way light dues payments are enforced in the UK and Ireland were implemented from 1 April 2015 to give effect to this agreement. <ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/commissioners-of-irish-lights |title=Commissioners of Irish Lights |publisher=Department for Transport |date=2014-10-16 |accessdate=2015-04-02}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
{{Lighthouses}} [[Category:Lighthouses]] [[Category:Navigation]]

revision.comment: /* Mapping not geodesy */
revision.text:
This is a '''list of geocoding systems''', in the sense of schemes that assign systematic labels to geographic entities.
This is ''not'' a list of software systems that can perform [[geocoding]] in the sense of turning a geographic name into a [[latitude]] and [[longitude]].
Some of these code systems are free for use, others have different [[licence]]s.
==Administrative== Codes with only partial coverture of the globe, mainlly for "administrative regions", like countries or biomes.
'''General''' use: *[[ISO 3166-1]] and [[ISO 3166-2]]: country codes and codes of its subdivisions *[[Hierarchical administrative subdivision codes|HASC]] (Hierarchical Administrative Subdivision Codes) *[[ONS coding system|ONS]] code, [[United Kingdom|UK]] only, administrative *[[MARC country code]]s *[[Standard Geographical Classification code (Canada)|SGC codes]], [[Canada]] only, statistical *[[UN M.49]] region codes, area code, continents, countries (like [[ISO 3166-1 numeric]])
'''Airport''' codes:
*[[IATA airport code]]s, area /point codes, airports and 3-letter city codes *[[ICAO airport code]]s, area /point codes, airports
'''Internet''' codes: [[IANA country code]]s similar to [[ISO 3166-1 alpha-2]]
'''Sport''' codes: [[IOC country code]]s, area, worldwide
'''Environment''' codes: [[Longhurst code]], a set of four-letter codes used in ecological geography
=== National standards === * [[United States|U.S.]], '''FIPS''' codes: **[[FIPS country code]]s (FIPS 10-4), area code, administrative, free **[[FIPS place code]]s (FIPS 55) [[United States|U.S.]] only, free **[[FIPS county code]]s (FIPS 6-4) US only, free **[[FIPS state code]]s (FIPS 5-2) US only
==Geodesy== :Summarized from [[Discrete_Global_Grid#Geocoding_variants|Discrete Global Grid]]
Popular or in "official use":
*[[ISO 6709]] Standard Representation for Geographic Point Location by Coordinates *[[Universal Transverse Mercator|UTM]] *[[Geohash]] and [[Geohash-36]] open-source [[hash function|hash]] notation for locations *[[Open Location Code]] (PlusCode) *[[What3words]], patent-restrictions system, converts 3x3 meter squares into 3 words <ref>{{cite web|title=What3words: Find and share very precise locations via Google Maps with just 3 words|url=https://thenextweb.com/apps/2013/07/02/what3words-a-new-way-to-search-for-and-share-locations-via-google-maps-with-just-3-words-universal-address-system/|accessdate=8 July 2014}}</ref>
Old or "low use":
*[[C-squares]] - compact encoding of geographic coordinate bounds (latitude-longitude)
*[[World Geographic Reference System]] (GEOREF), a military / air navigation coordinate system for point and area identification
*Geotude, converts latitude and longitude to a single string
*[[Global Area Reference System]] (GARS), reference system developed by the National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency (NGA)
*[[Military Grid Reference System]] (MGRS), derived from UTM and UPS grids by NATO with a unique naming convention
*[[Munich Orientation Convention]], converts lat/lon to metrical monopolar codes for targets, crossings, stations, stop points, bridges, tunnels, towns, islands, volcanoes, highway exits etc. <ref>[http://www.navipedia.org/index.php/Step By Step Navigation|Navipedia / ESA]{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
*S2, a geocoding scheme using [[spherical geometry]] and the space-filling [[Hilbert curve]], developed at [[Google]]<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://s2geometry.io/about/overview|title=Overview|website=s2geometry.io|language=en|access-date=2018-05-11}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://medium.com/sidewalk-talk/s2-cells-and-space-filling-curves-keys-to-building-better-digital-map-tools-for-cities-a312aa5e2f59|title=S2 cells and space-filling curves: Keys to building better digital map tools for cities|last=Kreiss|first=Sven|date=2016-07-27|website=Medium|access-date=2018-05-11}}</ref>
* [[World Meteorological Organization squares|WMO squares]]
*{{anchor|GEOID}}GEOID, the name of [[United States Census Bureau]] geographic identifiers.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.census.gov/geo/reference/geoidentifiers.html | title = Understanding Geographic Identifiers (GEOIDs) | website = [[United States Census Bureau]] | accessdate = March 3, 2016}}</ref>
==Telephony & radio broadcasting== *[[ITU letter codes|ITU-R country code]]s *[[ITU-T country calling code]]s *[[ITU-T mobile calling code]]s *[[Maidenhead Locator System]] (used by amateur radio operators) *[[Marsden Square]]s
==Postal address== *[[Postal code]]s, area, worldwide, country-codes by [[UPU]], free *[[Natural Area Code|NAC]], area codes (area can be indefinitely small) *[[Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics|NUTS]] area code, partially administrative, worldwide: countries, Europe : country to community *[[Postal addresses in the Republic of Ireland#OpenPostcode|OpenPostcode]], opensource global algorithm (local adaptations as Irish & Hong Kong postcodes).<ref>{{cite web|title=OpenPostcode.org|url=http://www.openpostcode.org|accessdate=10 June 2012}}</ref> *[[Munich Orientation Convention]]
==Mapping not geodesy== *[[WOEID]] *[[OpenStreetMap]] shortlink, used as a short permanent link to map locations *[[QDGC|Quarter Degree Grid Cells]] *[[UN M.49]] region codes, area code, continents, countries (like [[ISO 3166-1 numeric]]) *[[SALB]] (Second Administrative Level Boundaries), by UN [http://www.unsalb.org/] *[[UN/LOCODE]], area, administrative, cities *[[Munich Orientation Convention]] *[[Longhurst code]]
==References== {{reflist|30em}} {{Geocoding-systems}}
[[Category:Geocodes| ]]

revision.comment: Reverted 1 edit by [[Special:Contributions/2607:FEA8:A29F:F5E8:6CA1:FD80:1A27:8D7|2607:FEA8:A29F:F5E8:6CA1:FD80:1A27:8D7]] identified as test/vandalism using [[WP:STiki|STiki]]
revision.text:
'''Types of natural phenomena''' include:
[[Weather]], [[fog]], [[thunder]], [[tornado]]es; [[biological process]]es, [[decomposition]], [[germination]]; [[physical process]]es, [[wave propagation]], [[erosion]]; [[Tide|tidal flow]], and [[natural disasters]] such as [[electromagnetic pulse]]s, [[volcanic eruption]]s, and [[earthquake]]s.<ref>{{cite book |author1= Missy Allen |author2=Michel Peissel |year=1993 |title= Dangerous Natural Phenomena |url= https://books.google.com/books?isbn=079101794X |publisher= [[Chelsea House]] |isbn= 079101794X}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |author= William R. Corliss |year=1977 |title= Handbook of unusual natural phenomena |url= https://books.google.com/books?isbn=0915554011 |publisher= Sourcebook Project |isbn= 0915554011}}</ref>
==Biological== [[Image:DecayingPeachSmall.gif|frame|right|[Decomposition]: a decaying peach over a period of six days. Each frame is approximately 12 hours apart, as the fruit shrivels and becomes covered with [[mold]].]] * [[Decomposition]] – by which organic substances are broken down into a much simpler form of matter * [[Metabolism]] ** [[Catabolism]] ** [[Anabolism]] ** [[Fermentation]] – converts [[sugar]] to acids, gases and/or [[alcohol]]. * [[Cell growth|Growth]] * [[Population decrease]] ** [[Overpopulation]] growth beyond
== Chemical == [[File:Crystal in VCGS furnace.jpg|thumb|Crystal in VCGS furnace]] * [[Crystal growth]] * [[Oxidation]] ** [[Fire]] ** [[Rusting]]
== Geological == {{see also|List of geological phenomena}} [[File:Pahoeoe fountain edit2.jpg|thumb|Geology: [[parabola]]-shaped [[lava flow]] illustrates [[Galileo]]'s [[law of falling bodies]], as well as [[blackbody radiation]]. The [[temperature]] can be discerned from the color of the [[blackbody]].]] [[Geology|Geological]] processes include [[erosion]], [[sedimentation]], and [[Volcanism|volcanic activities]] such as geysers and [[earthquake]]s.
== Meteorological == {{see also|Atmospheric phenomenon|List of meteorological phenomena|List of severe weather phenomena}}
Violent [[Meteorology|meteorological]] phenomena are called [[storm]]s. Regular, cyclical phenomena include [[season]]s and [[atmospheric circulation]]. [[Climate change]] is often semi-regular.
<gallery class="center" widths="230px" heights="145px"> File:Galunggung.jpg|[[Lightning]] strikes during the eruption of the [[Galunggung]] [[volcano]] in 1982 File:Dszpics1.jpg|A [[tornado]] on May 3, 1999 in central Oklahoma </gallery>
===Atmospheric optical phenomena=== {{see also|Optical phenomena}} {{multiple image | width = thumb | footer = Atmospheric optical phenomenon | image1 = Double Bows.jpg | alt1 = | caption1 = A double rainbow at Minsi Lake, Pennsylvania | image2 = Bretagne Finistere Plouhinec 05002.jpg | alt2 = | caption2 = A [[sun pillar]] in [[Finistère]], [[Brittany]] }} {{col-start}} {{col-2}} * [[Aurora]] * [[Crepuscular rays]] * [[Green flash]] * [[Haze]] * [[Ice blink]] * [[Light pillar]] * [[Moonbow]] {{col-2}} * [[Moon dog]] * [[Rainbow]] * [[Subsun]] * [[Sun dog]] * [[Water sky]] * [[Monochrome Rainbow]] {{col-end}}
=== Nuclear and Electrical === * [[Elementary particle]] interactions * [[Supernova]] <gallery class="center" caption="" widths="160px" heights="200px"> File:Liquid hydrogen bubble chamber photograph of an anti-proton colliding with a proton.jpg|Liquid hydrogen bubble chamber photograph of an anti-proton colliding with a proton File:Static on the playground (48616367).jpg|Children notice an effect of static electricity File:STScl-2005-15.png|Supernova </gallery>
===Oceanographic=== [[File:Golfstrom.jpg|thumb|Gulfstream]] * [[Oceanography|Oceanographic]] phenomena include [[tsunami]]s, [[ocean current]]s and [[breaking wave]]s.
== Physical == * [[Gravity]]
==See also== {{div col|colwidth=30em}} * [[Act of God]] * [[Electrical phenomena]] * [[Template:Life timeline|Life timeline]] * [[Materialism]] * [[Midnight sun]] * [[Natural environment]] * [[Nature]] * [[Template:Nature timeline|Nature timeline]] * [[Transient lunar phenomenon]] {{div col end}}
==References== {{commons category|Natural phenomena}} {{reflist|colwidth=30em}} {{Portal bar|Ecology|Environment}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Natural phenomena}} [[Category:Atmospheric optical phenomena]] [[Category:Earth phenomena]] [[Category:Geography terminology]] [[Category:Nature-related lists]]

The first short section describes the borders or edges of [[continents]] and oceans/major seas. Disputed areas are not considered. ===[[Continent]]s=== ''(Notes: Dependencies and islands remote from continental land masses{{vague|date=October 2018}} are not considered and are '''excluded''' from this list section; thus only continental land borders are considered. page.title: List of presidential trips made by Barack Obama during 2014

revision.comment: /* June */
revision.text:
{{main|Presidency of Barack Obama}} [[File:Barack Obama and Shinzo Abe at Sukyabashi Jiro April 2014.jpg|thumb|Obama dining with Japanese Prime Minister [[Shinzō Abe]] at [[Sukiyabashi Jiro]] during his visit to [[Tokyo]], Japan, April 23, 2014]] This is a '''list of presidential trips made by [[Barack Obama]] during 2014''', the sixth year of [[Presidency of Barack Obama|his presidency]] as the [[List of Presidents of the United States|44th]] [[President of the United States]]. This list excludes trips made within [[Washington, D.C.]], the U.S. federal capital in which the [[White House]], the official residence and principal workplace of the President, is located. Additionally excluded are trips to [[Camp David]], the country residence of the President, and to the private home of the [[Family of Barack Obama|Obama family]] in [[Kenwood, Chicago|Kenwood]], [[Chicago]]. ==January== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{Flagicon|North Carolina}} ''[[North Carolina]]'' |[[Raleigh, North Carolina|Raleigh]] |January 15 |President Obama toured [[Vacon]] facilities and delivered remarks at the [[North Carolina State University]], regarding manufacturing jobs.{{cite web|last1=Slack|first1=Megan|title=North Carolina Is Home to America’s Newest High-Tech Manufacturing Hub|url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/blog/2014/01/15/north-carolina-home-america-s-newest-high-tech-manufacturing-hub|website=[[WhiteHouse.gov]]|accessdate=March 28, 2015|date=January 15, 2014}}{{cite news|title=President Obama announces new Raleigh-based manufacturing institute during North Carolina visit|url=http://abc11.com/politics/obama-unveils-plan-for-nc-innovation-hub/34877/|accessdate=March 28, 2015|publisher=[[WTVD]]|date=January 15, 2014}} |- |{{Flagicon|Pennsylvania}} ''[[Pennsylvania]]'' |[[Pittsburgh]] |January 29 |President Obama signed the [[myRA|''my''RA]] program and delivered remarks at [[U.S. Steel]]'s [[Mon Valley Works–Irvin Plant|Irvin plant]].{{cite news|last1=O'Toole|first1=James|title=President Obama delivers speech in West Mifflin|url=http://www.post-gazette.com/local/south/2014/01/29/President-Obama-land-in-Pittsburgh-headed-to-West-Mifflin/stories/201401290121|accessdate=March 28, 2015|publisher=''[[Pittsburgh Post-Gazette]]''|date=January 29, 2014}} |- |{{Flagicon|Wisconsin}} ''[[Wisconsin]]'' |[[Milwaukee]] |January 30 |President Obama visited [[General Electric]]'s Gas Engine Plant, where he delivered a speech regarding jobs and minimum wage.{{cite news|title=UPDATE: President Obama stops in Waukesha|url=http://www.nbc15.com/news/headlines/Pres-Obama-to-visit-Wisconsin-after-address-242242731.html|accessdate=March 28, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=[[WMTV]]|date=January 30, 2014}} |- |{{Flagicon|Tennessee}} ''[[Tennessee]]'' |[[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]] |January 30 |President Obama delivered a speech on education at [[McGavock High School]].{{cite news|last1=Gang|first1=Duane W.|title=Obama pushes education in Nashville|url=http://archive.tennessean.com/article/20140130/NEWS/301300140/Obama-pushes-education-Nashville|accessdate=March 28, 2014|publisher=''[[The Tennessean]]''|date=January 30, 2014}} |} ==February== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flagicon|Michigan}} ''[[Michigan]]'' |[[Lansing, Michigan|Lansing]],
[[East Lansing, Michigan|East Lansing]] |February 7 |President Obama toured the Michigan Biotechnology Institute in Lansing and signed the [[Agricultural Act of 2014]] at the [[Michigan State University]] in East Lansing.{{cite news|last1=Pickler|first1=Nedra|title=Obama signs farm bill that trims food stamps|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/ap/article-2553724/Obama-signs-farm-bill-trims-food-stamps.html|accessdate=March 28, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[Daily Mail]]''|date=February 7, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Virginia}} ''[[Virginia]]'' |[[Charlottesville, Virginia|Charlottesville]] |February 10 |President Obama took [[President of France|French President]] [[François Hollande]] on a trip to [[Monticello]], the residence of third President and [[Founding Fathers of the United States|Founding Father]] [[Thomas Jefferson]], who had served as a [[United States Ambassador to France|United States Minister to France]].{{cite news|last1=McCarthy|first1=Tom|title=Obama hosts French president François Hollande on state visit|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/feb/10/obama-french-president-francois-hollande-live|accessdate=March 28, 2015|publisher=''[[The Guardian]]''|date=February 10, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Maryland}} ''[[Maryland]]'' |[[Cambridge, Maryland|Cambridge]] |February 14 |President Obama spoke about [[Minimum wage in the United States|minimum wage]] increase and [[Immigration to the United States|immigration]] at the [[Democratic Caucus of the United States House of Representatives|House Democratic]] Issues Conference.{{cite news|last1=Babington|first1=Charles|title=Minimum wage increase, immigration overhaul top Obama’s agenda|url=https://www.pbs.org/newshour/rundown/minimum-wage-increases-immigration-overhaul-top-obamas-agenda/|accessdate=March 28, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[PBS NewsHour]]''|date=February 15, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|California}} ''[[California]]'' |[[Fresno, California|Fresno]],
[[Palm Springs, California|Palm Springs]] |February 14–17 |In Fresno, President Obama met with community leaders during a [[Round table (discussion)|round table discussion]] to discuss the [[2012–15 North American drought]], before meeting with farmers affected by the drought, where he announced a $183 million aid for drought relief programs in California.{{cite news|last1=Onishi|first1=Norimitsu|last2=Davenport|first2=Coral|title=Obama Announces Aid for Drought-Stricken California|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/02/15/us/politics/obama-to-announce-aid-for-drought-racked-california.html?_r=0|accessdate=March 28, 2015|publisher=''[[The New York Times]]''|date=February 14, 2014}} In Palm Springs, President Obama met with [[Abdullah II of Jordan|King Abdullah II]] of [[Jordan]] at the [[Sunnylands]] estate to discuss the [[Israeli–Palestinian peace process]] and the [[Syrian Civil War]].{{cite news|last1=Newkirk|first1=Barrett|last2=Kelman|first2=Brett|last3=Felci|first3=Erica|title=Jordan's king in Calif. to meet with Obama|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2014/02/13/jordans-king-in-calif-to-meet-with-obama/5471637/|accessdate=March 29, 2015|publisher=''[[The Desert Sun]]''|date=February 13, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Mexico}} [[Mexico]] |[[Toluca]] |February 19 |President Obama met with [[Prime Minister of Canada|Canadian Prime Minister]] [[Stephen Harper]] and [[President of Mexico|Mexican President]] [[Enrique Peña Nieto]] at the [[North American Leaders' Summit]] to discuss commerce, energy, immigration, and trade.{{cite news|title=Obama’s agenda criticized ahead of Mexico trade talks|url=http://america.aljazeera.com/articles/2014/2/19/obama-s-agenda-criticizedaheadofmexicosummit.html|accessdate=March 29, 2015|publisher=[[Al Jazeera America]]|date=February 19, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Minnesota}} ''[[Minnesota]]'' |[[Saint Paul, Minnesota|Saint Paul]] |February 26 |President Obama delivered remarks at the [[Saint Paul Union Depot]] regarding the investment of infrastructure improvement.{{cite news|last1=Zdechlik|first1=Mark|title=In Minn., Obama pitches $300B infrastructure plan|url=http://www.mprnews.org/story/2014/02/26/obama-seeking-300-billion-for-roads-railways|accessdate=March 29, 2015|publisher=[[Minnesota Public Radio]]|date=February 26, 2014}} |} ==March== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flagicon|Connecticut}} ''[[Connecticut]]'' |[[New Britain, Connecticut|New Britain]] |March 5 |President Obama delivered remarks at the [[Central Connecticut State University]] regarding the need to increase the [[Minimum wage in the United States#Federal|federal minimum wage]].{{cite news|last1=Brandon|first1=Heather|title=President Obama Visits Connecticut, in Tweets|url=http://wnpr.org/post/president-obama-visits-connecticut-tweets|accessdate=March 29, 2015|publisher=[[Connecticut Public Radio]]|date=March 5, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Massachusetts}} ''[[Massachusetts]]'' |[[Boston]] |March 5 |President Obama attended a round table discussion fundraiser for the [[Democratic National Committee]], before attending a dinner with the committee at [[Artists for Humanity#The Artists For Humanity EpiCenter|The Artists For Humanity EpiCenter]].{{cite The President also met with [[G7]] leaders at the [[Catshuis]] to discuss the [[Ukrainian crisis]] and met with [[Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands|King Willem-Alexander]] at the [[Royal Palace of Amsterdam]].{{cite news|last1=Sweet|first1=Lynn|title=Obama guidance & press schedule, March 24, 2014: The Netherlands|url=http://chicago.suntimes.com/politics/7/71/168143/obama-guidance-press-schedule-march-24-2014-the-netherlands|accessdate=March 29, 2015|publisher=''[[Chicago Sun-Times]]''|date=March 24, 2014}}{{cite news|last1=Miller|first1=Zeke J.|title=Obama Tries to Reassure Jittery Allies on Foreign Trip|url=http://time.com/34889/obama-trip-pope-francis/|accessdate=March 29, 2015|publisher=''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]''|date=March 23, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]] |[[Waregem]],

Robot|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/tech/innovation/obama-gets-kick-out-soccer-playing-asimo-robot-n88631|accessdate=March 29, 2015|publisher=[[NBC News]]|date=April 24, 2014}} before attending a [[state Korea]] |[[Seoul]] |April 25–26 |President Obama attended a wreath-laying ceremony at the [[War Memorial of Korea]] and visited [[Gyeongbokgung]], before meeting with [[President of South Korea|President]] [[Park Geun-hye]] at the [[Blue House]] to discuss [[North Korea]]'s [[Nuclear power in North Korea|nuclear threat]] and the U.S.-Korea Free Trade Agreement. In the wake of the [[Sinking of the MV Sewol|sinking]] of the [[MV Sewol|MV ''Sewol'']], President Obama also presented President Park with the [[Flag of the United States|American flag]] that flew over the White House during the day of the disaster (April 16), as well as presenting a [[magnolia]] seed to the [[Danwon High School]], which victimized a number of the high school's students and teachers. The following day, the President met with American and Korean business leaders to discuss the trade and economic cooperation between the two countries and delivered remarks at [[Yongsan Garrison]].{{cite web|last1=Kim|first1=Ellen|title=President Obama’s Visit to South Korea|url=http://cogitasia.com/president-obamas-visit-to-south-korea/|publisher=[[Center for Strategic and [[Abdul Halim of Kedah|Abdul Halim]] and [[Prime Minister of Malaysia|Prime Minister]] [[Najib Razak]].{{cite news|title=As Obama arrives, Zaid slams Putrajaya’s inability to say hudud is [[Istana Negara, Jalan Duta|Istana Negara]].{{cite news|last1=Superville|first1=Darlene|title=Royal welcome for Obama on historic Malaysia trip|url=http://www.theoaklandpress.com/general-news/20140426/royal-welcome-for-obama-on-historic-malaysia-trip|accessdate=March 30, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[The Oakland Press]]''|date=April 26, 2014}} On April 27, President Obama visited the [[National Mosque of Malaysia]], before holding a bilateral meeting and a joint press conference with Prime Minister Najib at the [[Perdana Putra]] to discuss issues on trade, defense, and maritime security, as well as the United States' commitment to contributing to the [[Search for Malaysia Airlines Flight 370|search]] for [[Malaysia Airlines Flight 370]].{{cite news|title=Obama says US committed to providing assets for MH370 ocean search|url=http://www.themalaymailonline.com/malaysia/article/obama-says-us-committed-to-providing-assets-for-mh370-ocean-search|accessdate=March 30, 2015|publisher=''[[The Malay Mail]]''|date=April 27, 2014}} He also delivered remarks at the [[Malaysian Global Innovation and Creativity Centre]] and participated in the Young Southeast Asian Leaders Initiative Town Hall meeting at the [[University of Malaya]]. |- |{{flagicon|Philippines}} [[Philippines]] |[[Manila]],

UN|url=http://chicago.suntimes.com/politics/7/71/155243/obama-guidance-schedule-sept-23-2014-syria-strikes-to-un|accessdate=April 2, 2015|publisher=''[[Chicago Sun-Times]]''|date=September 23, 2014}} presided the [[United Nations Security Council]] meeting to discuss a resolution against [[terrorism]],{{cite web|title=U.N. Security Council Meeting on Terrorism|url=http://www.c-span.org/video/?321668-1/president-obama-chairs-un-security-council-meeting-isis|publisher=[[C-SPAN]]|accessdate=April 2, 2015|date=September 24, 2014}} spoke at an [[Open Government Partnership]] event,{{cite web|title=10 World Leaders Speaking at #OGPatUN|url=http://www.opengovpartnership.org/blog/open-government-partnership/2014/09/17/10-world-leaders-speaking-ogpatun|publisher=[[Open Government Partnership]]|accessdate=April 3, 2015|date=September 17, 2014}} and met with [[Iraq]]i [[Prime Minister of Iraq|Prime Minister]] [[Haider al-Abadi]],{{cite news|last1=Mohammed|first1=Arshad|title=Iraqi PM says Islamic State plans subway attacks in U.S. and Paris|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/09/25/us-iraq-crisis-attack-idUSKCN0HK20I20140925|accessdate=April 2, 2015|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=September 25, 2014}} [[Egypt]]ian [[President of Egypt|President]] [[Abdel Fattah el-Sisi]],{{cite news|title=Obama meets with el-Sissi, says Egypt key to Mideast security Read more: Obama meets with el-Sissi, says Egypt key to Mideast security|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/obama-meets-with-el-sissi-says-egypt-key-to-mideast-security/|accessdate=April 2, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[The Times of Israel]]''|date=September 26, 2014}} and [[Ethiopia]]n [[Prime Minister of Ethiopia|Prime Minister]] [[Hailemariam Desalegn]].{{cite news|title=US President Barack Obama holds a bilateral meeting with Ethiopia's Prime Minister Hailemariam Desalegn in New York|url=http://www.siasat.com/photos/us-president-barack-obama-holds-bilateral-meeting-ethiopias-prime-minister-hailemariam-desal-0|accessdate=April 2, 2015|publisher=''[[The Siasat Daily]]''|date=September 26, 2014}} |} ==October== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flagicon|Indiana}} ''[[Indiana]]''
{{flagicon|Illinois}} ''[[Illinois]]'' |[[Gary, Indiana|Gary]],
[[Chicago]] |October 1–2 |President Obama arrived at [[Gary/Chicago International Airport]] in Gary, Indiana,{{cite news|title=Gary mayor asks Obama for longer visit next time|url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2014/oct/2/gary-mayor-asks-obama-for-longer-visit-next-time/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[The Washington Times]]''|date=October 2, 2014}} where he proceeded to Chicago to attend a fundraising event for [[Governor of Illinois|Governor]] [[Pat Quinn (politician)|Pat Quinn]], before delivering a speech on the economy at [[Northwestern University]].{{cite news|title=President Obama To Visit Northwestern For Speech On The Economy|url=http://chicago.cbslocal.com/2014/10/02/president-obama-to-visit-northwestern-for-speech-on-the-economy/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=[[CBS]]|date=October 2, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Indiana}} ''[[Indiana]]'' |[[Princeton, Indiana|Princeton]] |October 3 |President Obama visited the [http://www.millenniumsteelservice.com/ Millennium Steel Service] plant to deliver remarks on manufacturing and its effect on the economy.{{cite news|last1=Swiatek|first1=Jeff|title=President Obama touts strength of manufacturing in Indiana speech|url=http://www.indystar.com/story/money/2014/10/03/white-house-caller-surprised-southern-indiana-businessman/16612801/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=''[[The Indianapolis Star]]''|date=October 3, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|New York}} ''[[New York (state)|New York]]'' |[[New York City]] |October 7 |President Obama attended two Democratic National Committee events.{{cite news|last1=Lederman|first1=Josh|title=Obama visits NYC, Conn. Tuesday|url=http://www.myfoxny.com/story/26721979/obama-visit-nyc|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=[[WNYW]]|date=October 7, 2014}}{{cite news|last1=Sweet|first1=Lynn|title=Obama guidance, schedule, Oct. 7, 2014: NYC for Dem fundraisers|url=http://chicago.suntimes.com/politics/7/71/154709/obama-guidance-schedule-oct-7-2014-nyc-for-dem-fundraisers|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=''[[Chicago Sun-Times]]''|date=October 7, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Massachusetts}} ''[[Massachusetts]]'' |[[Greenwich, Massachusetts|Greenwich]] |October 7 |President Obama attended a fundraising event for the Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee.{{cite news|last1=Vigdor|first1=Neil|title=Obama draws Democratic supporters in Greenwich|url=http://www.ctpost.com/local/article/Obama-draws-Democratic-supporters-in-Greenwich-5807942.php#page-1|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=''[[Connecticut Post]]''|date=October 8, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|California}} ''[[California]]'' |[[Los Angeles County]],
[[San Francisco]] |October 9–11 |President Obama attended a town hall meeting on the economy at [http://www.crosscamp.us/ Cross Campus] in [[Santa Monica, California|Santa Monica]] and a fundraising event for the Democratic National Committee at the residence of actress [[Gwyneth Paltrow]] in [[Brentwood, Los Angeles|Brentwood]].{{cite news|title=Obama Hails "Millennials" as Driving Force in Rebuilding Economy|url=http://www.nbclosangeles.com/news/local/President-Barack-Obama-Fundraiser-Economic-Plan-Los-Angeles-Visit-Gwyneth-Paltrow-278692351.html|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[The Wire Report]]|publisher=[[KNBC]]|date=October 9, 2014}} The President also spoke at the [[Frank G. Bonelli Regional Park]] in [[San Dimas, California|San Dimas]] to declare [[San Gabriel Mountains National Monument|part]] of the [[San Gabriel Mountains]] a [[National Monument (United States)|National Monument]].{{cite news|title=President Obama declares part of San Gabriel Mountains a national monument|url=http://abc7.com/hobbies/president-obama-declares-part-of-san-gabriel-mountains-a-national-monument/345448/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=[[KABC-TV]]|date=October 10, 2014}} In San Francisco, President Obama attended a round table discussion and a fundraising event for the Democratic National Committee at the residence of [[Zynga]] co-founder [[Mark Pincus]].{{cite news|title=President Obama Wraps Up San Francisco Fundraising Trip|url=http://www.nbcbayarea.com/news/local/President-Obama-in-San-Francisco-Friday-for-DNC-Fundraisers-278739871.html|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=[[KNTV]]|date=October 11, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Illinois}} ''[[Illinois]]'' |[[Chicago]] |October 19–20 |President Obama attended a campaign rally for Governor Pat Quinn at the [[Chicago State University]], as well as a Democratic National Committee fundraising event. The President also cast an [[Early voting|early vote]] for the [[United States elections, 2014|2014 midterm elections]].{{cite news|title=Obama Fires Up Democrats, Urges Early Voting For Quinn|url=http://chicago.cbslocal.com/2014/10/20/obama-fires-up-democrats-urges-early-voting-for-quinn/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=[[CBS]]|date=October 20, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Wisconsin}} ''[[Wisconsin]]'' |[[Milwaukee]] |October 28 |President Obama delivered a speech at the campaign rally for [[Governor of Wisconsin|Governor]] [[Wisconsin gubernatorial election, 2014|candidate]] [[Mary Burke]] at the [[North Division High School (Milwaukee)|North Division High School]].{{cite news|last1=Newton-Small|first1=John|title=Obama Rallies Wisconsin Democrats for Mary Burke|url=http://time.com/3544687/barack-obama-mary-burke-governor-rally/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]''|date=October 29, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Maine}} ''[[Maine]]'' |[[Portland, Maine|Portland]],
[[Cape Elizabeth, Maine|Cape Elizabeth]] |October 30 |President Obama attended a fundraising event in Cape Elizabeth with [[United States House of Representatives|Representative]] [[Mike Michaud]], before attending a rally for Michaud's gubernatorial campaign at the [[Portland Exposition Building]].{{cite news|last1=Merrill|first1=Paul|title=President Obama visits Maine|url=http://www.wmtw.com/politics/obama-to-rally-for-michaud-in-portland/29426604|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=[[WMTW]]|date=October 30, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Rhode Island}} ''[[Rhode Island]]'' |[[Providence, Rhode Island|Providence]] |October 30–31 |President Obama attended a round table discussion with faculty and students at [[Rhode Island College]], before delivering a speech regarding the economy and women.{{cite news|last1=McGee|first1=Sandy|title=Women, economy focus of President Obama RIC speech|url=http://wpri.com/2014/10/31/women-economy-focuse-of-president-obama-ric-speech/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=[[WPRI-TV]]|date=November 1, 2014}} |} ==November== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flagicon|Michigan}} ''[[Michigan]]'' |[[Detroit]] |November 1 |President Obama delivered a speech at the [[Wayne State University]] to campaign for [[United States Senator|Senator]] [[United States Senate election in Michigan, 2014|candidate]] [[Gary Peters (politician)|Gary Peters]] and [[Governor of Michigan|Governor]] [[Michigan gubernatorial election, 2014|candidate]] [[Mark Schauer]].{{cite news|title=Obama Rallies Wayne State Crowd To Vote For Schauer, Peters On Tuesday|url=http://detroit.cbslocal.com/2014/11/01/obama-rallies-wayne-state-crowd-to-vote-for-schauer-peters-on-tuesday/|accessdate=May 1, 2015|publisher=[[WWJ-TV]]|date=November 1, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|China}} [[China]] |[[Beijing]] |November 10–12 |President Obama attended the [[APEC China 2014|APEC summit]]. On November 11–12, the President held bilateral meetings with [[President of the People's Republic of China|President]] [[Xi Jinping]] to discuss [[China–United States relations]] and international and regional issues, as well as [[Comparison of US and Chinese Military Armed Forces|military relations]], the [[One-China policy]], [[climate change]], and terrorism.{{cite news|title=Xi, Obama walk and talk one-on-one in Beijing|url=http://www.cctv-america.com/2014/11/11/xi-obama-walk-and-talk-in-beijing-u-s-presidents-visit-to-china-continues-tomorrow|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=[[CCTV America]]|date=November 11, 2014}}{{cite news|title=US-China bilateral talks cover several major issues|url=http://www.cctv-america.com/2014/11/12/us-china-bilateral-talks-covers-several-major-issues|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Xinhua News Agency]]|publisher=[[CCTV America]]|date=November 12, 2014}} The President also met with [[Premier of the People's Republic of China|Premier]] [[Li Keqiang]],{{cite news|title=Li meets Obama, vowing to speed up BIT negotiations|url=http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/world/2014apec/2014-11/12/content_18904104.htm|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Xinhua News Agency]]|publisher=''[[China Daily]]''|date=November 12, 2014}} [[Australia]]n [[Prime Minister of Australia|Prime Minister]] [[Tony Abbott]],{{cite news|last1=Pace |first1=Julie |title=Obama tempers expectations for thaw with NKorea |url=http://home.cableone.net/news/read/category/AP%20Online%20-%20International%20News/article/the_associated_press-obama_nkorea_detainee_talks_not_about_nuke_issue-ap |accessdate=April 3, 2015 |agency=[[Associated Press]] |publisher=[[Cable One]] |date=November 10, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150407144503/http://home.cableone.net/news/read/category/AP%20Online%20-%20International%20News/article/the_associated_press-obama_nkorea_detainee_talks_not_about_nuke_issue-ap |archivedate=April 7, 2015 |df= }} and [[Indonesia]]n [[President of Indonesia|President]] [[Joko Widodo]].{{cite news|title=In China, Obama tests global clout post-election|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/ap/article-2827269/Asia-trip-tests-Obamas-postelection-global-clout.html|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[Daily Mail]]''|date=November 10, 2014}}{{cite web|title=The President’s Trip to China, Burma and Australia |url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/issues/foreign-policy/asia-trip-2014 |website=[[WhiteHouse.gov]] |accessdate=April 3, 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151108004027/https://www.whitehouse.gov/issues/foreign-policy/asia-trip-2014 |archivedate=November 8, 2015 |df= }} |- |{{flagicon|Burma}} [[Burma|Myanmar (Burma)]] |[[Naypyidaw]],
[[Yangon]] |November 12–14 |In Naypyidaw, President Obama attended the [[Ninth East Asia Summit|East Asia Summit]] and the U.S.-[[Association of Southeast Asian Nations|ASEAN]] summit meeting.{{cite news|last1=Lederman|first1=Josh|title=Obama returns to Myanmar as country struggles with democratic transition|url=https://www.pbs.org/newshour/rundown/obama-meets-myanmar-leader-amid-fears-backslide/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[PBS NewsHour]]''|date=November 13, 2014}}{{cite news|last1=Herman|first1=Steve|title=Obama in Myanmar for ASEAN Meetings|url=http://www.voanews.com/content/asean-summit-opens-in-myanmar/2516846.html|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=[[Voice of America]]|date=November 12, 2014}} He met with [[President of Burma|President]] [[Thein Sein]] to discuss [[2011–12 Burmese political reforms|Burma's democratic reforms]] and also held a bilateral meeting with [[Vietnam]]ese [[Prime Minister of Vietnam|Prime Minister]] [[Nguyễn Tấn Dũng]].{{cite news|title=Obama backs Suu Kyi bid to change constitution|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/afp/article-2834271/Obama-backs-Suu-Kyi-bid-change-constitution.html|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=''[[Daily Mail]]''|date=November 14, 2014}}{{cite news|last1=Pace|first1=Julie|title=Myanmar troubles jeopardize a big Obama goal|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/ap/article-2830996/Obama-confront-shortcomings-Myanmar-reforms.html|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[Daily Mail]]''|date=November 13, 2014}} The President attended a round table discussion with members of the [[Assembly of the Union]], Speaker [[Shwe Mann]] of the [[House of Representatives (Burma)|House of Representatives]], Speaker [[Khin Aung Myint]] of the [[House of Nationalities]], and [[Opposition (Myanmar)|Opposition]] Leader [[Aung San Suu Kyi]] to further discuss Burma's democratic reforms.{{cite web|title=Remarks by President Obama After Roundtable at Parliamentary Resource Center|url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2014/11/13/remarks-president-obama-after-roundtable-parliamentary-resource-center-n|website=[[WhiteHouse.gov]]|accessdate=April 3, 2015|date=November 13, 2014}} In Yangon, President Obama held a bilateral meeting with Suu Kyi at [[54 University Avenue|her residence]], which was followed by a joint press conference,{{cite news|title=Barack Obama Holds Talks With Myanmar Democracy Champion Aung San Suu Kyi|url=http://www.ndtv.com/world-news/barack-obama-holds-talks-with-myanmar-democracy-champion-aung-san-suu-kyi-696954|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=[[NDTV]]|date=November 14, 2014}} before participating in the Young Southeast Asian Leaders Initiative Town Hall meeting at the [[University of Yangon]].{{cite web|title=Remarks by President Obama at Young Southeast Asian Leaders Initiative Town Hall, 11/14/14|url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2014/11/14/remarks-president-obama-young-southeast-asian-leaders-initiative-town-ha|website=[[WhiteHouse.gov]]|accessdate=April 3, 2015|date=November 14, 2014}} Additionally, the President had toured the [[Ministers' Building]] and attended a round table discussion with [[civil society]] organizations at the [[Embassy of the United States, Rangoon|United States Embassy in Yangon]].{{cite news|author1=Kyaw Phyo Tha|title=Obama Visits Site of Burmese Independence in Rangoon|url=http://www.irrawaddy.org/multimedia-burma/obama-visits-site-burmese-independence-rangoon.html|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=''[[The Irrawaddy]]''|date=November 14, 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150403085030/http://www.irrawaddy.org/multimedia-burma/obama-visits-site-burmese-independence-rangoon.html|archivedate=April 3, 2015|df=}}{{cite web|title=Remarks by President Obama After Civil Society Roundtable|url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2014/11/14/remarks-president-obama-after-civil-society-roundtable|website=[[WhiteHouse.gov]]|accessdate=April 3, 2015|date=November 14, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Australia}} [[Australia]] |[[Brisbane]] |November 15–16 |President Obama attended the [[2014 G20 Brisbane summit|G20 summit]] held at the [[Brisbane Convention & Exhibition Centre]].{{cite news|last1=Taylor|first1=Lenore|title=G20: Barack Obama uses visit to reassert US influence in Asia Pacific|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/nov/15/g20-barack-obama-uses-visit-to-reassert-us-influence-in-asia-pacific|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=''[[The Guardian]]''|date=November 15, 2014}} The President also held a trilateral meeting with Prime Minister Tony Abbott and [[Japan]]ese [[Prime Minister of Japan|Prime Minister]] [[Shinzō Abe]] to discuss [[Russia]]'s [[Annexation of Crimea by the Russian Federation|annexation]] of [[Crimea]] and delivered a speech at the [[University of Queensland]] regarding [[youth voice]].{{cite news|last1=Spetalnick|first1=Matt|last2=Siegel|first2=Matt|title=U.S., Japan and Australia vow to oppose Russian action in Crimea|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/11/16/us-g20-summit-trilateral-idUSKCN0J000L20141116|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=November 15, 2014}}{{cite web|title=President Obama inspires students with landmark speech|url=http://www.uq.edu.au/news/article/2014/11/president-obama-inspires-students-landmark-speech|publisher=[[University of Queensland]]|accessdate=April 3, 2015|date=November 16, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Nevada}} ''[[Nevada]]'' |[[Las Vegas]] |November 21 |President Obama delivered a speech at the [[Del Sol High School]] to discuss his [[Immigration reform#Obama's executive actions of November 2014|executive plans for an immigration reform]].{{cite news|last1=Lee|first1=Brianna|title=Immigration: Obama Las Vegas Speech Pressures Congress, #PassABill Trends On Twitter|url=http://www.ibtimes.com/immigration-obama-las-vegas-speech-pressures-congress-passabill-trends-twitter-1727873|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=''[[International Business Times]]''|date=November 21, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Illinois}} ''[[Illinois]]'' |[[Chicago]] |November 25 |President Obama spoke at the [[Gateway Theatre (Chicago)|Mitchell P. Kobelinski Theater]] to promote his executive plans for an immigration reform.{{cite news|last1=Schulte|first1=Sarah|title=Pres. Obama in Chicago to talk immigration policies|url=http://abc7chicago.com/politics/pres-obama-in-chicago-to-talk-immigration-policies/411041/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=[[WLS-TV]]|date=November 25, 2014}} |} ==December== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flagicon|Maryland}} ''[[Maryland]]'' |[[Bethesda, Maryland|Bethesda]] |December 2 |President Obama met with injured troops at the [[Walter Reed National Military Medical Center]],{{cite news|last1=Sweet|first1=Lynn|title=Obama guidance, press schedule Dec. 2, 2014. Hagel, Ebola|url=http://chicago.suntimes.com/politics/7/71/213947/obama-guidance-press-schedule-dec-2-2014-hagel-ebola|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=''[[Chicago Sun-Times]]''|date=December 2, 2014}} before touring the [[National Institutes of Health]], where he spoke on the efforts to fighting the [[Ebola virus epidemic in West Africa|Ebola virus epidemic]] in [[West Africa]].{{cite news|title=President Obama talks about Ebola at NIH|url=http://www.wusa9.com/story/news/health/2014/12/02/president-obama-nih-bethesda-md-visit-about-ebola/19771917/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=[[WUSA (TV)|WUSA]]|date=December 3, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Tennessee}} ''[[Tennessee]]'' |[[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]] |December 9 |President Obama delivered remarks at [http://www.casaazafran.org/ Casa Azafrán] to discuss his executive plans for an immigration reform.{{cite news|last1=Zezima|first1=Katie|last2=Nakamura|first2=David|title=Obama takes pitch for immigration reform to Nashville|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/why-nashville-is-the-backdrop-for-obamas-immigration-pitch/2014/12/09/cfeaea10-7f71-11e4-9f38-95a187e4c1f7_story.html|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=''[[The Washington Post]]''|date=December 9, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|New Jersey}} ''[[New Jersey]]'' |[[Joint Base McGuire–Dix–Lakehurst]] |December 15 |President Obama spoke to American troops returning from [[Afghanistan]] at Joint Base McGuire–Dix–Lakehurst.{{cite news|title=UPDATES: Obama thanks troops at Joint Base|url=http://www.courierpostonline.com/story/news/local/south-jersey/2014/12/15/live-today-obama-thanks-troops-at-joint-base/20426081/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=''[[Courier-Post]]''|date=December 15, 2014}} |} ==References== {{reflist|3}} {{Barack Obama}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Presidential Trips Made By Barack Obama during 2014}} [[Category:2014 in the This is a list of many '''lists of countries and territories''' by various definitions, including FIFA countries, federations, and fictional countries. A [[country]] or territory is a geographical area, either in the sense of ''[[nation]]'' (a cultural entity) or ''[[Sovereign state|state]]'' (a political entity).<ref>The [[Oxford English Dictionary]], Second Edition, with online updates as of September 2008. Entry "1. country"</ref>

revision.comment: Disambiguated: [[ESRI]] → [[Environmental Systems Research Institute]]
revision.text:
{{Refimprove|date=February 2016}}
'''Location intelligence''' ('''LI'''), or '''spatial intelligence''', is the process of deriving meaningful insight from [[geographic data and information|geospatial data]] relationships to solve a particular problem.<ref>Data Resources For Real Estate And Business Geography Analysis. Thrall,G.,I.,Ph.D.(2009)/Professor, Department of Geography, College of Liberal Arts And Sciences and Miller Center For Retail, College of Business, University of Florida</ref> It involves layering multiple data sets spatially and/or chronologically, for easy reference on a map, and its applications span industries, categories and organizations.
Maps have been used to represent information throughout the ages, but what might be referenced as the first example of true location 'intelligence' was in London in 1854 when [[John Snow]] was able to debunk theories about the spread of cholera by overlaying a map of the area with the location of water pumps and was able to narrow the source to a single water pump. This layering of information over a map was able to identify relationships between different sets of geospatial data.
Location or [[geographical information system]] (GIS) tools enable spatial experts to collect, store, [[data analysis|analyze]] and [[data visualization|visualize data]]. Location intelligence experts can use a variety of spatial and business analytical tools to measure optimal locations for operating a business or providing a service. Location intelligence experts begin with defining the [[business ecosystem]] which has many interconnected economic influences. Such economic influences include but are not limited to culture, lifestyle, labor, healthcare, cost of living, crime, economic climate and education.
==Further definitions== The term "location intelligence" is often used to describe the people, data and technology employed to geographically "map" information. These mapping applications can transform large amounts of data into color-coded visual representations that make it easy to see trends and generate meaningful intelligence. The creation of location intelligence is directed by [[domain knowledge]], formal frameworks, and a focus on decision support. Location cuts across through everything i.e. devices, platforms, software and apps, and is one of the most important ingredient of understanding context in sync with social data, mobile data, user data, sensor data.
Location intelligence is also used to describe the integration of a geographical component into [[business intelligence]] processes and tools, often incorporating [[spatial database]] and spatial [[OLAP]] tools.
In 2012, Wayne Gearey from the [[real estate industry]] ([[JLL (company)|JLL]]) offered the first applied course on location intelligence at the University of Texas at Dallas in which he defined location intelligence as the process for selecting the optimal location that will support workplace success and address a variety of business and financial objectives.<ref name="RealViews 2015">{{cite web|url=https://www.jllrealviews.com/trends/why-location-intelligence-is-a-game-changer-for-the-property-industry/|title=Why location intelligence is a ‘game changer’ for real estate|last=Avery|first=Lois|date=2015-05-20|website=RealViews|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161019164338/https://www.jllrealviews.com/trends/why-location-intelligence-is-a-game-changer-for-the-property-industry/|archive-date=2016-10-19|dead-url=yes|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=W.M. Gearey, N.M.Trodd, A. Fobes|title=Utilizing Location Intelligence for the Placement of Corporate Services|url=http://www.gla.ac.uk/media/media_401758_en.pdf}}</ref>
[[Pitney Bowes]] MapInfo Corporation describes location intelligence as follows: "Spatial information, commonly known as "Location", relates to involving, or having the nature of where. Spatial is not constrained to a geographic location however most common business uses of spatial information deal with how spatial information is tied to a location on the earth. Miriam-Webster® defines Intelligence as "The ability to learn or understand, or the ability to apply knowledge to manipulate one`s environment." Combining these terms alludes to how you achieve an understanding of the spatial aspect of information and apply it to achieve a significant competitive advantage."<ref>{{cite web |author=George Moon |publisher=Pitney Bowes |url=http://www.pbinsight.com/files/resource-library/resource-files/LocationIntell_WP_2-27Final.pdf |format=PDF |language=en |title=Location Intelligence – Meeting IT Expectation |date=c. 2008 |access-date=2015-10-05}}</ref>
Definition by [[Environmental Systems Research Institute|ESRI]] is as follows: "Location Intelligence is defined as the capacity to organize and understand complex data through the use of geographic relationships. LI organizes business and geographically referenced data to reveal the relationship of location to people, events, transactions, facilities, and assets."<ref>{{cite web |author=ESRI |url=https://www.esri.com/~/media/files/pdfs/library/whitepapers/pdfs/using-location-intelligence.pdf |format=PDF |language=en |title=Using Location Intelligence to Maximize the Value of BI |access-date=2015-10-05}}</ref>
Definition by [[Yankee Group]] within their White Paper "Location Intelligence in Retail Banking: "...a business management term that refers to spatial data visualization, contextualization and analytical capabilities applied to solve a business problem."<ref>{{cite web |author=Marcus Torchia |publisher=Pitney Bowes |url=http://www.pbinsight.com/files/resource-library/resource-files/yankee-group.pdf |format=PDF |language=en |title=Location Intelligence in Retail Banking |date=c. 2009 |access-date=2015-10-05}}</ref>
[[Near (company)|Near]] defines location intelligence as the gamut of geo-spatial analytic models, algorithms, techniques and tools that harness location-indexed streaming and static data to provide requisite answers to questions around location such as the attributes of i) a place, ii) people visiting a place, and iii) products consumed at a place. Location intelligence platforms encapsulate these technologies, ingest relevant data sources, and provide it as data-as-a-service, or use it to power data-driven products.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mmaglobal.com/articles/location-intelligence-next-frontier |title= Location Intelligence: The Next Frontier|publisher=Mobile Marketing Association, Inc|date=May 3, 2016}}</ref>
Instarea defines location intelligence as "Using [[machine learning]] algorithms to uncover trends that would be otherwise unknown using human based rules in a large location data set."<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.gartner.com/doc/3795764|title=Market Trends: Ways CSPs Can Exploit Location Data|last=|first=|date=|website=Gartner.com|language=en|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-07-24}}</ref>
==Commercial applications==
Location intelligence is used by a broad range of industries to improve overall business results. Applications include: * [[Communications]] and [[telecommunications]]: [[Network planning and design]], boundary identification, identifying new customer markets. * [[Financial services]]: Optimize branch locations, market analysis, [[Share of Wallet|share of wallet]] and [[cross-sell]] activities, [[mergers & acquisitions]], industry sector analysis, risk management. * [[Government]]: Census updates, law enforcement crime analysis, emergency response, environmental and land management, electoral [[redistricting]], tax jurisdiction assignment, [[urban planning]]. * [[Healthcare]]: Site selection, [[market segmentation]], network analysis, growth assessments. * [[Higher education]]: Student Recruitment, Alumni & Donor Tracking, Campus Mapping. * [[Hotel]]s and [[restaurant]]s: Customer profile analysis, site selection, [[target marketing]], expansion planning. * [[Insurance]]: Address validation, underwriting and [[risk management]], claims management, marketing and sales analysis, [[market penetration]] studies. * [[Mass media|Media]]: [[Target market]] identification, subscriber demographics, [[media planning]]. * [[Real estate]]: Site reports, comprehensive site analysis, retail modeling, presentation quality maps. * [[Retail]]: Site selection, maximize per-store sales, identify under-performing stores, market analysis. * [[Transportation]]: Transport planning, route monitoring. * [[K-12]] : School Site Selection, enrollment planning, school attendance area modification (boundary change), school consolidation, district consolidation, student achievement plotting.
== See also == * [[Geographic information system]] (GIS)
== References == {{reflist}}
[[Category:Business intelligence]] [[Category:Market research]] [[Category:Strategic management]] [[Category:Geographic data and information]]

An alluvial '''[http://www.megafans.in/ megafan]''' is a large cone or fan-shaped deposit built up by complex deposition patterns of stream flows originating from a single source point known as an apex. Megafans differ from [[Alluvial fan]]s in their sheer size. Due to their larger size, they may be formed by different geomorphic processes. The criterion of what differentiates megafans from typical alluvial fans is an artificial one of scale. The scale divide varies in the literature, with the most common being a 100-km apex-to-toe length. Alternative values as little of 30-km apex-to-toe length have been proposed, as well as alternative metrics like coverage areas of greater than 10,000 square-km.<ref>{{cite journal | last1 = Latrubesse | first1 = E. M. | authorlink = Edgardo M. Latrubesse | year = 2015 | title = Large rivers, megafans and other Quaternary avulsive fluvial systems: A potential "who's who" in the geological record | url = http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0012825215000562 | journal = Earth-Science Reviews | volume = 146| issue = | pages = 1–30| doi=10.1016/j.earscirev.2015.03.004}}</ref>
==Formation== The flow source from the apex occupies a portion of the fans apron, building up that portion with depositions. Through complex processes like avulsion, the stream changes course over time occupying different areas of the fan. Over long periods of time, sediment builds up creating a fan formation. Generally the three-dimensional architecture of megafan deposits consists of multi-storied sandsheets, gravel in upper reaches, interbedded with overbank muddy layers, thickness and facies distribution vary from upstream to downstream reaches <ref>{{cite journal | last1 = Latrubesse | first1 = E. M. | authorlink = Edgardo M. Latrubesse | last2 = Stevaux | first2 = J. C. | last3 = Sinha | first3 = R. | year = 2005 | title = Tropical rivers | url = http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0169555X05000723 | journal = Geomorphology | volume = 70 | issue = 3| pages = 187–206 | doi=10.1016/j.geomorph.2005.02.005}}</ref>
Rivers forming large fans happen in various settings around the world most notably, in foreland settings (e.g. Kosi, Gandak, Pastaza), intracratonic basins (e.g. Pantanal, Taquari, Cuiaba), and in complex settings like in the case of Pilcomayo. Although the distribution of megafans occur throughout many environments, the Tropics are home of the largest megafans of the world in the Chaco Plain,<ref>{{cite journal | last1 = Latrubesse | first1 = E. M. | authorlink = Edgardo M. Latrubesse | last2 = Stevaux | first2 = J. C. | last3 = Cremon | first3 = E. H. | last4 = May | first4 = J. H. | last5 = Tatumi | first5 = S. H. | last6 = Hurtado | first6 = M. A. | last7 = Argollo | first7 = J. B. | year = 2012 | title = Late Quaternary megafans, fans and fluvio-aeolian interactions in the Bolivian Chaco, Tropical South America. ''Palaeogeography, Palaeoclimatology'' | url = http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0031018212001988 | journal = Palaeoecology | volume = 356 | issue = | pages = 75–88 | doi=10.1016/j.palaeo.2012.04.003}}</ref> with the largest being the Pilcomayo.<ref>{{cite journal | last1 = Iriondo | first1 = M | year = 1993 | title = Geomorphology and late quaternary of the Chaco (South America) | url = http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/0169555X9390059B | journal = Geomorphology | volume = 7 | issue = 4| pages = 289–303 | doi=10.1016/0169-555X(93)90059-B}}</ref>
===Examples of Megafans=== *Pilcomayo - Chaco Plain *Grande - Chaco Plain *Bermejo - Argentina *Kosi - Gangetic plain of India *Gandak - Gangetic plain of India *Okavango *Taquari
==Gallery==
<gallery widths="225px" heights="190px" perrow="3"> Image:Alluvial fan, Taklimakan Desert, XinJiang Province, China, NASA, ASTER.jpg|A 60 km long Megafan across the desolate [[landscape]] between the [[Kunlun Mountains|Kunlun]] and [[Altyn-Tagh|Altun]] [[mountain range]]s that form the southern border of the [[Taklamakan Desert]] in [[Xinjiang]]. The left side is the active part of the fan, and appears blue from water flowing in the many small streams Image:Pantanal Basin.jpg|Taquari Megafan in the Pantanal Basin </gallery>
==See also== *[[Alluvium]] *[[Alluvial plain]] *[[Alluvial fan]] *[[Avulsion (river)|Avulsion]] *[[Floodplain]] *[[Placer deposit]] *[[River delta]] *[[Subaqueous fan]]
==References== <references/>
{{DEFAULTSORT:Megafan}} [[Category:Sedimentology]] [[Category:Fluvial landforms]] [[Category:Geography terminology]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox sport | name = Munzee | image = Munzee logo September 2018.svg | imagesize = | caption = | union = | nickname = | first = July 1, 2011, Texas | registered = | clubs = | contact = | team = *Rob Vardeman - President *Scott Foster - Co-Founder and VP of Technology *TJ Ogroske - VP of Marketing and Sales *Daniel Fischer - Backend Developer *Trish Vandehey - Graphic Design *Daniel Hammock - Player Support *Dylan Derryberry -Director of Operations for Eventzee *Matthew McCann - Director of Media and Player Relations *Louise Gibson- Munzee Events Manager *Robbie McGuire- Customer Support Enthusiast *Judy Nguyen- Front End Developer/Designer
| mgender = | category = Outdoor | equipment = [[Mobile phone]] or [[Tablet computer]] with [[GPS receiver]] | venue = [[Earth]] | obsolete = | olympic = | website = [http://www.munzee.com Munzee] }} [[File:WikiMunzee.png|thumb|Illustration of a Munzee, which players create and hide for other players to find]]
'''Munzee''' is a [[freemium]] [[scavenger hunt]] game where places have to be found in the real world. The game is similar to [[geocaching]] but uses [[QR code]] technology, in addition to device [[GPS]] location, to prove the find instead of a logbook. Launched in [[Texas]] in 2011, the game caught on first in [[Germany]], along with [[California]] and [[Michigan]]. It is now played in more than 188 countries around the world, and there is at least one physical Munzee deployed on every continent, including [[Antarctica]].<ref name = "Spencer"/><ref>{{cite journal|last=Dorsey|first=Erika|title=Member Spotlight|journal=Heartland Highlights|date=2012|url=https://heartlandowners.org/rally/2013/LTA_munzee_hand-out.pdf}}</ref>
The places are marked by other players using QR codes, which are hidden and often printed on weatherproof stickers. The places can also be marked by a [[Near field communication|NFC]] tag.<ref>{{cite web|last=Clark|first=Mike|title=Munzee adds NFC to geolocation game|url=http://www.nfcworld.com/2012/09/05/317625/munzee-adds-nfc-to-geolocation-game/|publisher=NFC World|accessdate=28 December 2012}}</ref> These stickers are called Munzees. Both the finding and the hiding players receive points for deploying and finding Munzees. The QR codes on the Munzees are read by means of a [[smartphone]] app for [[iOS]], [[Android (operating system)|Android]] or Windows. <ref name = "Spencer">{{cite news|last=Spencer|first=Susan|url=http://www.telegram.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20121110/NEWS/111109916/1246|title=New game in town|accessdate=28 December 2012|newspaper=Telegram}}</ref> The coordinates of the Munzees as well as the data of the players are managed via the central web platform.
Virtual Munzees are also available for purchase. These also appear in app lists and on maps, and they are "captured" by locating the app device within 300 feet of the designated location. The device must also be within 300 feet of a QR code Munzee to verify "capture."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://speurvuur.nl/site/wat-is-munzee?lang=en |title=About Munzee |publisher=speurvuur.nl |accessdate=2014-01-24}}</ref>
== History == A common misconception is that the idea for Munzee was inspired by [[geocaching]], a game in which participants search for a hidden cache using GPS technology. However, Munzee co-founder Aaron Benzick (having never been a geocacher) came up with the idea of using QR codes for a game in 2008, but smartphone technology and capability were not available at the time.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.scntx.com/articles/2011/07/03/plano_star-courier/news/8970.txt|title='M' marks the spot: Locally based Munzee takes hi-tech scavenger hunts global|last=Rush|first=Jessica|date=July 3, 2011 |work=Plano Courier Star|accessdate=28 December 2012}}</ref> Benzick, and co-founders, Scott Foster, Chris Pick, and Josh Terkelsen launched the game on July 1, 2011. The term Munzee was derived from the German word for coin, Münze. Since the domain name munze.com was no longer available, an e was added, which also resulted in what the company felt was a catchy name.<ref>[https://munzee.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/211253046 ]</ref> The original idea was to use poker chips or rounded coins with QR codes. <ref>{{cite news|last=Rush|first=Jessica|title=Resident promotes hi-tech scavenger hunt|url=http://www.littleelmjournal.net/articles/2011/07/13/little_elm_journal/news/9077.txt|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120909232553/http://www.littleelmjournal.net/articles/2011/07/13/little_elm_journal/news/9077.txt|dead-url=yes|archive-date=September 9, 2012|accessdate=28 December 2012|newspaper=Little Elm|date=July 13, 2011}}</ref>
== Munzees == [[File:Munzee.jpg|thumb|Munzee on the back of a traffic sign]]
Munzees can consist of any material; they must have at minimum a QR-code and physically meet the conditions of the location (waterproof, weatherproof, etc.). Munzees either can be self-generated and printed or be purchased via the web store or through authorised distributors.<ref>{{cite news|last=Brinkman|first=Lillie-Beth|title=Get App-y's odds and ends — Munzee, Pictorama, Flock|url=http://newsok.com/get-app-ys-odds-and-ends-munzee-pictorama-flock/article/3710556?custom_click=rss|accessdate=28 December 2012|newspaper=NewsOK|date=September 18, 2012}}</ref> NFC Munzees and Virtual Munzees can be purchased from the web store.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://store.munzee.com/Game-Pieces/ |title=Munzee store |publisher=munzee.com |accessdate=2014-01-24}}</ref>
To generate or to order Munzees one has to be logged in on the central platform with a unique username. When generating a Munzee, the platform creates a web link, over which the generated Munzee can be managed. This web link is represented as a QR code on the Munzee. A descriptive name and an arbitrarily long comment can be assigned to the Munzee as properties. Both are stored on the central platform (not in the QR code) and can be changed later.
After a Munzee is physically created, it can be assigned coordinates anywhere outdoors or indoor and then deployed via the app. Business Munzees are also available which are deployed inside a business.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.munzee.com/business |title=Business munzees |publisher=munzee.com |accessdate=2014-01-24}}</ref> Once the Munzee has been deployed it goes live on the map and is ready to be found or "captured" by other players.<ref>{{cite web|last=Faulkner|first=Adrian|title=Munzee – A scavenger hunt for your smartphone|url=http://gpstracklog.com/2012/08/munzee-a-scavenger-hunt-for-your-smartphone.html|publisher=GPS Tracklog|accessdate=28 December 2012}}</ref> If a Munzee is damaged or taken down, players can report the malfunction and after two reports the Munzee is taken off the map.
The coordinates of all globally mounted Munzees are managed on the game platform at munzee.com. <ref>{{cite web|last=Bourque|first=Andre|title=Driving Kids to Succeed through Gamification|url=http://www.business2community.com/mobile-apps/driving-kids-to-succeed-through-gamification-0281691|publisher=Business 2 Community|accessdate=28 December 2012}}</ref> Players navigate themselves to the general location of a Munzee by accessing the map with a smartphone. When they find a Munzee, they capture it by either scanning the QR code or being within a certain radius of the published coordinates. The smartphone app sends the data scanned along with current coordinates to the central system which records the capture. The finder and the player that deployed the Munzee each earn points. The points award to the person who deploys the munzee and who captures the munzee vary depending on the playing piece deployed.
== Dissemination == As of January 2018, there are more than 7 million munzees worldwide in 235 countries, and more than 189 million Munzee captures had been recorded.<ref>{{cite web|title=About|url=http://statzee.munzee.com/|accessdate=July 19, 2016}}</ref>
== References == <references/>
== External links == * [http://www.munzee.com Munzee web platform]
[[Category:Outdoor locating games]] [[Category:2011 establishments in Texas]] [[Category:Navigation]] [[Category:Hobbies]] [[Category:Internet object tracking]] [[Category:Near Field Communications]]
